boat.name: Royal Oak
boat.full_description: Royal Oak is one of the last BRA 12 boats designed by George Cockshott in 1937 by Bonds of Rockferry. The class was in the 1924 and 1928 and adopted by the Dutch and Italians, used by the Royal Navy for training export worldwide
boat.construction_details: Royal Oak built by Bond’s in 1937, one of the Dreadnought fleet built for West Kirby Sailing Club in 1913, originals built by Roberts of Chester. Designed by George Cockshott of Southport Corinthian Yacht Club. Last remaining boat of the fleet.
boat.short_description: Royal Oak built by Bond’s in 1937, one of the Dreadnought fleet built for West Kirby Sailing Club in 1913, originals built by Roberts of Chester. Designed by George Cockshott of Southport Corinthian Yacht Club. Last remaining boat of the fleet.
